result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonah Scott Gardner

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:54 AM Defendant Jonah S Gardner in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Jonah S Gardner.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions where matter is at.  Atty Viel indicates cases are close to resolution, would like global resolution. Atty Viel indicates cases are old, requests one case be scheduled for trial on chance doesn't resolve.  State requests 21CF115 be scheduled for trial.  Plea/sentencing is scheduled for all cases.  Bond remains in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

11:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonah Scott Gardner in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Jonah Scott Gardner. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Court not requiring form be filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Waiver of Prelim on July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:41 AM . Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonah Scott Gardner in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Jonah Scott Gardner.  Preliminary hearing will be addressed at next date.  Atty Viel requests one more status date. Indicates attempting to resolve all cases together. Bond remains in effect.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Court amends cash bond from $3000 to $3250. All other conditions remain in effect as previously set.

10:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonah Scott Gardner in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Jonah Scott Gardner.  Court addresses states request to modify cash bond.  State makes statement. Defense makes statement. Court grants states request, modifies cash bond.

ADDRESS INFO for Jonah Scott Gardner
Current: 157 Commercial Street, Forestville, WI 54213 United States  (Effective: 06-23-2022)
Prior: 610 N 4th Avenue, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235
Bail/bond hearing on June 23, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Motion to Modify Bond

2:20 PM Defendant Jonah S Gardner not in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, indicates defendant is awaiting SPD appointment in Br. 1 files.  State indicates defendant may be confused as to Br. 1 and Br. 2 hearing dates, requests these cases be put on in Br. 2 when defendant is scheduled to return on 6/23/22 at 10:40 am. .
Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Per SPD, they are still looking for an attorney to represent defendant.
Reetz 2022 supplemental court appointed attorney bill (approved by Court)
2022 Reetz court apptd atty bill $317.29.  (approved by Court)
Status conference on April 4, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

2:42 PM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jonah Scott Gardner appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Court reviews events in file, reviews State's motion to modify bond.   Atty Reetz would like to continue with the balance of the IA and argue bond.  Atty Reetz indicates he will then be moving to withdraw from the case as his office was advised that defendant now qualifies for SPD representation.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim.  Discussion regarding bond modification.  Court not amending bond, will set a cash bond in new file instead.  Atty Reetz moves to withdraw from the case.  Court grants request.  Court orders defendant to contact SPD to see if he qualifies and if so, have Atty Reetz appointed to his case. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on February 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Proposed Order to Modify Bond
Motion to Modify Bond.           Pamela: Set this on for hearing Monday the 21st at 10:15. Atty Reetz is here on another matter at 10:00 that morning. DTE
Defendant fingerprinted on 1/21/22.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jonah Scott Gardner appeared by video from the Door County Jail, Attorney Brett E Reetz appeared in court for Jonah Scott Gardner.  Atty Reetz requests time to discuss with client.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Cash bond posted by McKenzie Sperber

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release - Drug Monitoring.

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jonah Scott Gardner appeared by video from the Door County Jail. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history. Defendant requests court appointed attorney.  Court appoints Brett Reetz. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
